KH.content: mytheme, acc. Hegel, will have been a prephilosopheme promised to a dialectical Aufhebung > teleological future anterior resembles narrative while marking end of narrative fiction
KH.linkedContent: mytheme, acc. Hegel, will have been a prephilosopheme promised to a dialectical Aufhebung > teleological future anterior resembles narrative while marking end of narrative fiction

KH.content: each narrative content (fable, legend, myth, fiction) becomes in turn a different tale, each tale a receptacle, harboring/lodging (hypodokhè), the most insistent determination of khōra ——but there is no tale of her, a secret w/out secret remains forever impenetrable à son sujet
KH.linkedContent: each narrative content (fable, legend, myth, fiction) becomes in turn a different tale, each tale a receptacle, harboring/lodging (hypodokhè), the most insistent determination of khōra ——but there is no tale of her, a secret w/out secret remains forever impenetrable à son sujet

KH.content: structure of inclusion in Timaeus: included [2nd] fiction, the theme of the prior fiction, which is its [the 2nd fiction’s] including form, its [the 2nd fiction’s] receptacle > mythopoetic string of events [see p. 121 each fiction as content given form in receptacle of another]
KH.linkedContent: structure of inclusion in Timaeus: included [2nd] fiction, the theme of the prior fiction, which is its [the 2nd fiction’s] including form, its [the 2nd fiction’s] receptacle > mythopoetic string of events [see p. 121 each fiction as content given form in receptacle of another]

GT.content: whole economy of narrative [“Counterfeit Money”] proceeds from a remainder, change returned, return of an unproductive expenditure [capitalizes?]
GT.linkedContent: whole economy of narrative [“Counterfeit Money”] proceeds from a remainder, change returned, return of an unproductive expenditure [capitalizes?]

GT.content: through a movement of transference, narrator has affected fabric of relation itself
GT.linkedContent: through a movement of transference, narrator has affected fabric of relation itself

GT.content: one usually believes narrative does not recount itself but an object outside of it; [Derrida considers that] what happens happens to the narrator, as if the narrative condition were the cause of the recounted thing, as if the narrative produced the event it was supposed to report
GT.linkedContent: one usually believes narrative does not recount itself but an object outside of it; [Derrida considers that] what happens happens to the narrator, as if the narrative condition were the cause of the recounted thing, as if the narrative produced the event it was supposed to report

GT.content: narrative gives possibility of impossibility of story as story of gift or forgiveness
GT.linkedContent: narrative gives possibility of impossibility of story as story of gift or forgiveness

GT.content: condition of knowing, desire to know (ēpistemē, historia rerum gestarum) [which Derrida relates to the possibility of narration], gives rise to history itself (res gestae, Geschehen, Geschichte)
GT.linkedContent: condition of knowing, desire to know (ēpistemē, historia rerum gestarum) [which Derrida relates to the possibility of narration], gives rise to history itself (res gestae, Geschehen, Geschichte)

GT.content: do Heidegger and Hegel argue the reverse? [history gives rise to narration?]
GT.linkedContent: do Heidegger and Hegel argue the reverse? [history gives rise to narration?]

GT.content: Derrida effectively reminds us that the characters are before the law in the same way as narration and textual dissemination [literature in general]
GT.linkedContent: Derrida effectively reminds us that the characters are before the law in the same way as narration and textual dissemination [literature in general]

GT.content: readability of text structured by unreadability of secret, narrator in situation analogous to reader; crypt gives to be read, eternally unreadable
GT.linkedContent: readability of text structured by unreadability of secret, narrator in situation analogous to reader; crypt gives to be read, eternally unreadable

GT.content: time of story given to the narrator, oriented toward him, not w/out interest
GT.linkedContent: time of story given to the narrator, oriented toward him, not w/out interest

GT.content: Baudelaire inscribes a naturalization in institution called literature, narrator occupies place of nature; via simulacrum, narrative resembles birth of literature
GT.linkedContent: Baudelaire inscribes a naturalization in institution called literature, narrator occupies place of nature; via simulacrum, narrative resembles birth of literature

LOBL.content: narrative of an event, event of narrative, narrative as the structure of an event
LOBL.linkedContent: narrative of an event, event of narrative, narrative as the structure of an event

LOBL.content: demand (mean English “demand”: request, order, petition) for a narrative [see p. 98 law]
LOBL.linkedContent: demand (mean English “demand”: request, order, petition) for a narrative [see p. 98 law]

LOBL.content: all organized narration, a matter for the police, narrative voice surpasses police investigation, if possible
LOBL.linkedContent: all organized narration, a matter for the police, narrative voice surpasses police investigation, if possible

LOBL.content: the Il (who says “I”) donne la mort, he, the narrator (I), kills
LOBL.linkedContent: the Il (who says “I”) donne la mort, he, the narrator (I), kills

LOBL.content: terribleness of la chose, not only ineffable, unnarratable: it’s interdictory, it forbids telling/seeing
LOBL.linkedContent: terribleness of la chose, not only ineffable, unnarratable: it’s interdictory, it forbids telling/seeing

LOBL.content: survivre delays at once life & death, line of least sure sur-, no clear-cut opposition, living on like differance, beyond identity & difference > tele-phone, tele-gram only 2 modes of this teleography in which trace, grapheme, does come secondarily but marks telic structure a priori
LOBL.linkedContent: survivre delays at once life & death, line of least sure sur-, no clear-cut opposition, living on like differance, beyond identity & difference > tele-phone, tele-gram only 2 modes of this teleography in which trace, grapheme, does come secondarily but marks telic structure a priori

LOBL.content: narrator is always away (at a distance, tele-)
LOBL.linkedContent: narrator is always away (at a distance, tele-)

LOBL.content: narrative affect of bottomless sorrow is allied w/ strange, insignificant coldness: mourning beyond measure
LOBL.linkedContent: narrative affect of bottomless sorrow is allied w/ strange, insignificant coldness: mourning beyond measure

BL.content: narrativity determines each atom of the text
BL.linkedContent: narrativity determines each atom of the text

BL.content: paradox, enigma before-the-law > ainigma, a relation, story, fable
BL.linkedContent: paradox, enigma before-the-law > ainigma, a relation, story, fable

BL.content: Kant: typology, symbolic presentation of moral good (beauty, a symbol of morality), respect for law which only appears in law > “as if” in maxim: reconciles practical reason w/ historical teleology (narrative), w/ possibility of unlimited progress
BL.linkedContent: Kant: typology, symbolic presentation of moral good (beauty, a symbol of morality), respect for law which only appears in law > “as if” in maxim: reconciles practical reason w/ historical teleology (narrative), w/ possibility of unlimited progress

BL.content: law should never give rise to story > law of law: to be invested w/ categorical authority, law must have no history, genesis, no possible derivation
BL.linkedContent: law should never give rise to story > law of law: to be invested w/ categorical authority, law must have no history, genesis, no possible derivation

BL.content: time: resolution of non-resolution—brings story into being and sustains it, only appears after law of delay, advance of law, anachrony of relation
BL.linkedContent: time: resolution of non-resolution—brings story into being and sustains it, only appears after law of delay, advance of law, anachrony of relation

MPM.content: Derrida, lover of memory, never knew how to tell a story, never received gift (doron) of Mnemosyne, the wax imprint, an eidolon [Derrida has a relation to memory beyond the imprint?]: keeps the memory loses the narrative
MPM.linkedContent: Derrida, lover of memory, never knew how to tell a story, never received gift (doron) of Mnemosyne, the wax imprint, an eidolon [Derrida has a relation to memory beyond the imprint?]: keeps the memory loses the narrative

MPM.content: deconstruction grows strong by accumulating forces that try to repress it, w/out being able to totalize them, “like those surplus values from which a victim of aggression always profits” > here, totalization is what an account, story and narrative are denied
MPM.linkedContent: deconstruction grows strong by accumulating forces that try to repress it, w/out being able to totalize them, “like those surplus values from which a victim of aggression always profits” > here, totalization is what an account, story and narrative are denied

S.content: epochality is the hidden teleology of the narrative order
S.linkedContent: epochality is the hidden teleology of the narrative order

S.content: pre-originary pledge of “yes,” wordless word of language, an event where memory comes before any souvenir, where faith defeats any narrative, la gage engage dans la langue
S.linkedContent: pre-originary pledge of “yes,” wordless word of language, an event where memory comes before any souvenir, where faith defeats any narrative, la gage engage dans la langue

VP.content: phenomenological reduction requires temporalization and is limited by it; phenomenological reduction is a scene
VP.linkedContent: phenomenological reduction requires temporalization and is limited by it; phenomenological reduction is a scene

F.content: the Thing is encrypted by crypt (for du Moi, self’s safe) not w/in (dans) it; crypted structure of ultimate referent [Thing] means double articulation (history, story) coalesces all these genres: myth, poem, novel, drama, translation > the narrated event never appears
F.linkedContent: the Thing is encrypted by crypt (for du Moi, self’s safe) not w/in (dans) it; crypted structure of ultimate referent [Thing] means double articulation (history, story) coalesces all these genres: myth, poem, novel, drama, translation > the narrated event never appears

P.content: distance from colossal, to be colossal (not too far, not too close), aesthetic maximum w/out losing itself in mathematical infinite > relation of body to stone
P.linkedContent: distance from colossal, to be colossal (not too far, not too close), aesthetic maximum w/out losing itself in mathematical infinite > relation of body to stone

P.content: distance required by the sublime opens up perception to space of narrative? divergence btwn apprehension/comprehension? doesn’t it call itself, w/ narrative voice: the colossal?
P.linkedContent: distance required by the sublime opens up perception to space of narrative? divergence btwn apprehension/comprehension? doesn’t it call itself, w/ narrative voice: the colossal?

POS.content: Derrida mocks the doctors of scientific genealogy or ideological filiation re: Heidegger’s thought [Faye for one] > what’s lacking in the “problematic of the narrative” is reflection on what makes the theses unnarratable
POS.linkedContent: Derrida mocks the doctors of scientific genealogy or ideological filiation re: Heidegger’s thought [Faye for one] > what’s lacking in the “problematic of the narrative” is reflection on what makes the theses unnarratable

ROP.content: Bartleby as figure of death, as secret of literature, makes narrator (man of law) talk
ROP.linkedContent: Bartleby as figure of death, as secret of literature, makes narrator (man of law) talk

ATIA.content: bottomless gaze of other [Levinas], the animal [?], seeing not just seen eyes of other; abyssal limit of the human, ends of man, bordercrossing where man announces himself, ultimate and first event of the end, unveiling, verdict; instant of extreme passion, je suis the apocalypse itself > when all this passes I can speak calmly of beasts of Apocalypse, visit them at the zoo
ATIA.linkedContent: bottomless gaze of other [Levinas], the animal [?], seeing not just seen eyes of other; abyssal limit of the human, ends of man, bordercrossing where man announces himself, ultimate and first event of the end, unveiling, verdict; instant of extreme passion, je suis the apocalypse itself > when all this passes I can speak calmly of beasts of Apocalypse, visit them at the zoo

TB.content: Babel as metaphor of metaphor, narrative of narrative, translation of translation: not only structure hollowing itself out like that, but does so in its own way > its idiom would have to be saved
TB.linkedContent: Babel as metaphor of metaphor, narrative of narrative, translation of translation: not only structure hollowing itself out like that, but does so in its own way > its idiom would have to be saved

PIO.content: allegory as structure of event in “Fable”: brought into sequential order, narrative form, then [?] it reaches out to other [Paul de Man]
PIO.linkedContent: allegory as structure of event in “Fable”: brought into sequential order, narrative form, then [?] it reaches out to other [Paul de Man]

PIO.content: for de Man, irony is structure of instant: “climaxes in…single brief moment of a final pointe” (“a synchronic structure”); allegory (other face of irony) unfolds in diachronic of narrative
PIO.linkedContent: for de Man, irony is structure of instant: “climaxes in…single brief moment of a final pointe” (“a synchronic structure”); allegory (other face of irony) unfolds in diachronic of narrative

PJP.content: the 3 meanings of Le Parjure, each haunts each other, raises the # of titles (3+n): 1) the novel itself [“Counterfeit Money”], narrator betrays truth confided in him 2) betrayal, unfulfilled promise of hero of novel 3) the legal perjury, le parjure committed by le parjure
PJP.linkedContent: the 3 meanings of Le Parjure, each haunts each other, raises the # of titles (3+n): 1) the novel itself [“Counterfeit Money”], narrator betrays truth confided in him 2) betrayal, unfulfilled promise of hero of novel 3) the legal perjury, le parjure committed by le parjure

PJP.content: Miller: “storytelling” (lying/narration), memory as precarious support of narrative continuity
PJP.linkedContent: Miller: “storytelling” (lying/narration), memory as precarious support of narrative continuity

PJP.content: tragedy of testimonial narration > encrypt while unveiling
PJP.linkedContent: tragedy of testimonial narration > encrypt while unveiling

PJP.content: anacoluthon gives rise to fictions or perhaps undecidable lie, perjury, that never can be excluded on part of narrator, author
PJP.linkedContent: anacoluthon gives rise to fictions or perhaps undecidable lie, perjury, that never can be excluded on part of narrator, author

PJP.content: anacoluthic substitution of subject, replacement of acolyte—motor, motivation, dramatic emotion of narrative
PJP.linkedContent: anacoluthic substitution of subject, replacement of acolyte—motor, motivation, dramatic emotion of narrative

PJP.content: generalized anacoluthon would make narrator an acolyte of his “character” or “friend”
PJP.linkedContent: generalized anacoluthon would make narrator an acolyte of his “character” or “friend”

PJP.content: identificatory substitution would harbor the betrayal, perjury, at heart of every narration, confession, “relation,” rapport
PJP.linkedContent: identificatory substitution would harbor the betrayal, perjury, at heart of every narration, confession, “relation,” rapport

PJP.content: [identificatory substitution] wreaks havoc w/ veracity while being its condition
PJP.linkedContent: [identificatory substitution] wreaks havoc w/ veracity while being its condition

PJP.content: narrator, unconscious subject, smuggles, yes, yes, the contrary into the narrative (denegative form [“I am not Chalier”] > yet another disavowal at heart of avowal)
PJP.linkedContent: narrator, unconscious subject, smuggles, yes, yes, the contrary into the narrative (denegative form [“I am not Chalier”] > yet another disavowal at heart of avowal)

PJP.content: narrative of a disappearance: signature gets erased moment it enters literature [like question in EJQB]
PJP.linkedContent: narrative of a disappearance: signature gets erased moment it enters literature [like question in EJQB]

PJP.content: when narrator claims to be quoting: makes the other say
PJP.linkedContent: when narrator claims to be quoting: makes the other say

C.content: retrace one’s steps, narrative (récit), series, funeral procession/palindrome, revenir: le revenu de l’usure, le revenant, l’hôte, ghost, guest [both in English] > le coffin comme hôtel de passe (whore-hotel)
C.linkedContent: retrace one’s steps, narrative (récit), series, funeral procession/palindrome, revenir: le revenu de l’usure, le revenant, l’hôte, ghost, guest [both in English] > le coffin comme hôtel de passe (whore-hotel)

C.content: order of narrative, whose trap has been situated by logic of cartouche
C.linkedContent: order of narrative, whose trap has been situated by logic of cartouche

C.content: unity of a period (of a detour) is indeterminable: each article presents perforated cards that transform the other > tombe, in the snare (dans le lacs)
C.linkedContent: unity of a period (of a detour) is indeterminable: each article presents perforated cards that transform the other > tombe, in the snare (dans le lacs)

TN.content: to continually tell a story, start again, stems (tient) from impossible alliance of contact & syncope
TN.linkedContent: to continually tell a story, start again, stems (tient) from impossible alliance of contact & syncope

TN.content: always writing a story, tangent touches line/surface w/out intersection, a tangent touches one point, point is nothing, a limit w/out depth or surface, untouchable even as a figure
TN.linkedContent: always writing a story, tangent touches line/surface w/out intersection, a tangent touches one point, point is nothing, a limit w/out depth or surface, untouchable even as a figure

LG.content: [vis-à-vis Blanchot] I bring forth to light (donne le jour) precisely the law as the right-to-sight (droit de voir), this law has “me” at its/her disposal? > the “I” sans “I” of narrative voice does not take place, engenders the lawmen [panoptic demand: synopsis]
LG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Blanchot] I bring forth to light (donne le jour) precisely the law as the right-to-sight (droit de voir), this law has “me” at its/her disposal? > the “I” sans “I” of narrative voice does not take place, engenders the lawmen [panoptic demand: synopsis]

LG.content: non-place, hypertopological mobility of narrative voice
LG.linkedContent: non-place, hypertopological mobility of narrative voice

LG.content: [re: Blanchot] for the law to see her day is her madness—what she loves madly like glory > he, the author, brings forth light of day to a mother who can’t say “I”
LG.linkedContent: [re: Blanchot] for the law to see her day is her madness—what she loves madly like glory > he, the author, brings forth light of day to a mother who can’t say “I”

BSi.content: narrative/representation structural to sovereignty, its force, its dynamis and its energeia (virtual & actual power) > sovereignty draws all its power from simulacrum-, fiction-, representation-effect > mystification of representation constituted by the simulacrum of a true transfer of sovereignty
BSi.linkedContent: narrative/representation structural to sovereignty, its force, its dynamis and its energeia (virtual & actual power) > sovereignty draws all its power from simulacrum-, fiction-, representation-effect > mystification of representation constituted by the simulacrum of a true transfer of sovereignty

ATAP.content: general narrator at moment of signature calls itself the witness (martyrōn, testimonium)
ATAP.linkedContent: general narrator at moment of signature calls itself the witness (martyrōn, testimonium)

SPEC.content: every [?] vacancy, enigma, calls for narrative

FV.content: “Seminar” treats only content (narrated face) of Poe’s Purloined Letter, not narration itself
FV.linkedContent: “Seminar” treats only content (narrated face) of Poe’s Purloined Letter, not narration itself

FV.content: Lacan neutralizes 4th character, the general narrator, thus neutralizes narrating operation
FV.linkedContent: Lacan neutralizes 4th character, the general narrator, thus neutralizes narrating operation

FV.content: inscriber/inscribing function not to be confused w/ author > Lacan excludes textual fiction, indicates a general narrative w/in neutralized or naturalized frame, thus overlooks the frame
FV.linkedContent: inscriber/inscribing function not to be confused w/ author > Lacan excludes textual fiction, indicates a general narrative w/in neutralized or naturalized frame, thus overlooks the frame

FV.content: reading [for narrator of Purloined…], treasure w/out price
[re: Poe’s Purloined…] no neutralization possible when public corporation (société anonyme) of capital & desire inaugurates narration
FV.linkedContent: [re: Poe’s Purloined…] no neutralization possible when public corporation (société anonyme) of capital & desire inaugurates narration

FV.content: the fancy (fantastique) of an identification btwn 2 doubled doubles, the narrator inside what he narrates, makes [Lacan’s] triangular logic very limited play w/in the play
FV.linkedContent: the fancy (fantastique) of an identification btwn 2 doubled doubles, the narrator inside what he narrates, makes [Lacan’s] triangular logic very limited play w/in the play
